status.name: Closed

fields.description:
*Problem*
I've noticed Titanium's IDE (Eclipse) slows down if a lot of Projects are open in Project Explorer.
So I've dabbled quite a bit into Node.ACS, though I would like to close these projects. Though everytime I close Node.ACS projects, I always get this error (roughly every ~2 minutes):
{code}'Updating clients' server URLs' has encountered a problem. [Project name] is not open{code}
I've tried removing the app from being deployed onto ACS, and still get this error... Should I just delete the project? (or too much of an overkill?)

*Log*
{code}!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 372 2013-08-21 08:16:01.068
!MESSAGE Resource '/NodeFinanDemo' is not open.{code}
fields.summary: Node.ACS - Error: 'Updating clients' server URLs' has encountered a problem. Project not Open
fields.environment:
Mac OSX 10.8.2
Ti Studio 3.1.1
Ti SDK 3.2

comments.body:
Hi Joseph,

This is fixed in Studio 3.1.2, please upgrade. Thanks.

Closing as duplicate of TISTUD-4998.
